alert.note: Alert for Covington; Forrest; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 1:18PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Forrest, eastern Covington and Jones Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 117 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rawls Springs, or near Hattiesburg, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Eastabuchie around 120 PM CDT. Moselle and Macedonia around 125 PM CDT. Laurel and Ellisville around 135 PM CDT. Ovett around 140 PM CDT. Tuckers Crossing around 145 PM CDT. Mill Creek around 155 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Seminary and Soso. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
